critique: This executive order concerns the transfer of administrative functions related to national cemeteries and memorials in Europe from the War Department to the American Battle Monuments Commission. It revokes a previous order that would have transferred these functions to the Department of State. The order also addresses the transfer of personnel, records, supplies, equipment, and unexpended funds. There is a provision for delaying the effective date if the President deems it necessary for economic reasons. This document appears to be primarily an administrative reorganization. It doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It has a slight impact on federalism and executive power, but not significantly. It also has a very minor impact on economic regulation.
